NcssCount.description:
Description

This rule uses the NCSS (Non-Commenting Source Statements) metric to determine the number of lines
of code in a class, method or constructor. NCSS ignores comments, blank lines, and only counts actual
statements. For more details on the calculation, see the documentationNCSS.

Example(s):

Use this rule with the default properties by just referencing it:

Use this rule and customize it:
NcssCount.option:
Name	Default Value	Description
methodReportLevel	60	NCSS reporting threshold for methods
classReportLevel	1500	NCSS reporting threshold for classes
ncssOptions		Choose options for the computation of NcssZero or more of:countImports
